intro: Arrabidaea isthmica, commonly known as the Isthmus glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as swamps and marshes, and is often found in the coastal plain regions. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
